AttackerCapabilities: Understanding of web page structure and functionality
Ability to intercept and modify HTTP requests

Vulnerabilities: Lack of server-side validation for password reset functionality
Insecure storage of credentials in HTML source code
SecurityMeasures: Encryption of sensitive data during transmission (HTTPS)
Strong password hashing and storage practices

Steps.Description: Analyzing the PCAP file, the attacker identifies interesting packets related to the forgot password functionality.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects that the forgot password functionality may have vulnerabilities that can be exploited.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker analyzes the PCAP file to inspect the HTTP requests and responses.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds a POST request to /forgotpassword.html and retrieves the HTML response containing the forgot password form.

Steps.Description: The attacker examines the HTML response and identifies the presence of a username, password, and email input fields.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the forgot password functionality may have separate fields for username and email, and that the email field may not have server-side validation.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker inspects the HTML source code and identifies the input fields for username, password, and email.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker confirms the presence of separate fields for username and email, and notes the JavaScript code that copies the value from the username field to the email field.

Steps.Description: The attacker intercepts and modifies the forgot password request to change the email address to one they control.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that by modifying the email field in the forgot password request, they can receive the password reset link for a user's account.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker intercepts the forgot password request and modifies the email field to their own email address.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker receives the password reset link in their own email inbox.
